intro: Psychotria tsaratananensis var. pubescens, commonly known as the Madagascar Psychotria, is a species native to the rainforests of Madagascar. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family, characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a pubescent underside. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers, which are often fragrant. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments and is noted for its ornamental value. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
